settings.title: About the shop
settings.content: Timeless Jewelry! Extraordinary craftmanship meets 3D design and the newest technology when creating NUIT et LINETTE jewelry. Crafted in solid gold, platinum and 925 sterling silver, made to last for generations.

settings.title: Diamond traceability
settings.content: NUIT et LINETTE diamonds are conflict free andethically sourced. Responsibly-mined diamonds from the Ekati and Diavik mine in Canada’s Northwest Territories.
settings.link_text: Learn more about the origin of NUIT et LINETTE diamonds.

settings.heading: About
settings.text: Perfectionist, diamond expert, jeweler. A few of the key words that describes Linette.

settings.heading: Build your own Ring
settings.text: Select your diamond, setting style, precious metal and add engraving.

settings.title: Bespoke
settings.content: Cufflinks in 14K gold with round brilliant cut diamonds

settings.heading: See the new summer collection today!
linette
settings.text:
In 2009 in Copenhagen, Denmark, and at the age of only 17, Linette Haaning had a vision to design jewelry with a raw, simple and feminine look made of exclusively high-end materials.


Linette’s greatest inspiration is found in Nature, anything from the curves of a beetle to the texture on a leaf. A nominalist approach, close attention to detail and a functional, timeless Scandinavian touch can be seen throughout her work. Linette has always been a perfectionist and has a special eye for detail. These characteristics are the heart of NUIT et LINETTE; where the details are not just details – they make the design – the details become the source of expression of the collection.


Her choice of only using the best materials reflects her dedication to quality as well as beauty. From pieces made out of 925 sterling silver to styles in solid 14K and 18K gold set with brilliant-cut diamonds, NUIT et LINETTE is luxurious while still affordable for everyone.
The dream behind NUIT et LINETTE is to create personal, meaningful pieces that will last forever.

Linette completed the Graduate Jeweler program from Gemological Institute of America (GIA) in Carlsbad, California in 2015. Shortly after, she also received diplomas for completing the CAD/CAM and Graduate Diamonds program. Learning the craftsmanship from some of the best
people the gem and jewelry industry has to offer definitely made her an even bigger perfectionist than before.

Image: Linette at the Copenhagen store.

settings.heading: Diamond traceability
settings.text:
NUIT et LINETTE diamonds are conflict free and ethically sourced. Responsibly-mined diamonds from the Ekati and Diavik mine in Canada’s Northwest Territories are CanadaMark™ hallmarked.



Foto:
© Arctic Canadian Diamond Company Lt

settings.heading: Origin
settings.text:
NUIT et LINETTE will provide origin reports for diamonds with a carat weight of 0.30 ct and above. The mines in Canada must meet the local governments stringent environmental regulations and protect the natural environment.

Linette is proud to work with suppliers who support their local communities by investing in local infrastructure, healthcare and education of their employees. Suppliers who mine with respect of the sustainability of the naturalenvironment. At the Ekati mine 98% of the water used in operations is recycled.
If requested NUIT et LINETTE can also provide diamonds from Botswana, Namibia and South Africa.

Foto: © Arctic Canadian Diamond Company Lt

settings.heading: Certification
settings.text: Each diamond is inscribed with their unique GIA certification number and CanadaMark™ serial number, which can be verified on the CanadaMark™ website. The certificate of Origin will also show the rough diamond weight before the diamond was cut and polished by manufacturers exclusively approved by CanadaMark™.

settings.heading: FROM ROUGH TO POLISHED DIAMOND
settings.text:
Before sending the diamond to the cutter the diamond is analyzed and inclusions are mapped. Once the diamond has been cut and polished it is returned to be matched with the original data. When the analyzed data matches the diamond, the serial number will be inscribed and certificate of Origin will be created. 

NUIT et LINETTE diamonds are cut in Surat, India by extremely talented manufacturers. Each rough diamond is carefully analyzed before being cut and polished. The cutter will make sure the diamond is cut to perfection and the light entering the diamond will reappear to the eye as fire, brilliance and sparkle.

settings.heading: TOURMALINES
settings.text: Tourmalines comes in one of the widest color range of any gemstone. The most desired colors are intense pink and green, also called rubellite and chrome. The Dutch imported it in the 17th century from Sri Lanka to Western and Central Europe. They named it Turamali, which in Sinhalese means “stone with mixed colors”. Tourmaline crystals only showing one color are quite rare. Most crystals will show various color tones. 7-7.5 on the Mohs hardness scale. This is a softer stone and contact with hard surfaces should be avoided.

settings.heading: BLACK TOURMALINATED QUARTZ
settings.text:
Each quartz has its own unique pattern, caused by the needle inclusions of black tourmaline. This type of quartz is one of Linette’s favorite stones because of its mysterious edgy look.

Rutilated quartz is another variety of quartz and have golden looking rutile needle inclusions.

settings.heading: AMBER
settings.text: Amber is fossilized, hardened resin from pine trees between 30-50 million years old. Amber is often brown, yellow or orange and sometimes it will have hints of white. Occasionally it will have inclusion of insects and plants.

settings.heading: PEARLS
settings.text: The process of a growing pearl is a fascinating process that requires dedication and patience. The growth in the oyster bed starts with a core in the cultivation process. In a natural pearl a shell, fishbone or sand floats into the pearl oyster and the mollusk starts to produce a pearl. Pollution is one of the factors that have reduced the supply of natural pearls. Therefore, in the cultivation process humans causes the mollusk to start producing a pearl by placing a foreign body in it. Pearls are one of natures miracles but also very delicate and should be worn with caution.

settings.heading: MOONSTONE
settings.text: Moonstones are a part of the feldspar group and are found in several colors among white, blue, grey, light peach and brown. The stone has a white shimmer like moonshine, therefore the name. Deposits of moonstone are found in Sri Lanka, Brazil, India, Burma, United States and Madagascar.

settings.heading: PRODUCT CARE
settings.text:
Jewelry from NUIT et LINETTE are made of natural materials like precious metals, diamonds and a variety of gemstones. NUIT et LINETTE jewelry can be passed on to the next generation if you take care of it and wear it with caution. We suggest that you have your jewelry that is set with brilliant cut diamonds, pearls or any other gemstones checked at least once a year. This is to prevent any loos or potential damage to the stones.

NUIT et LINETTE will only create jewelry in solid 18 K or 14 K gold.

White gold is an alloy and will never be perfectly white. Therefore, all NUIT et LINETTE’s white gold jewelry is plated with rhodium. The layer will slowly fade over time depending on how frequently the jewelry is being worn. To maintain the white or black look the jewelry must be plated with rhodium by NUIT et LINETTE again depending on how frequently the jewelry is being worn. Please contact NUIT et LINETTE if you want a new rhodium plating for your white gold jewelry.

Many of our 925 sterling silver jewelry designs are surface treated or have a textured surface. The surface treatment will fade over time because of contact with clothes, water, sweat and hard surfaces.
The black oxidized layer slowly fades with daily or frequent wear.

settings.heading: TEXTURED SURFACES
settings.text: When jewelry is being worn it will over time and with daily use come in contact with hard surfaces and other materials. A patina will appear on the surfaces and will affect textured as well as plated surfaces. Rings are often the most exposed pieces of jewelry.

settings.heading: HOW TO STORE AND WEAR YOUR JEWELRY:
settings.text:
- Always protect your jewelry from hard surfaces, chemicals, perfumes and body lotions.

- Do not wear your jewelry in a jacuzzi, swimming pool and sauna or while bathing and showering.

- Store your jewelry in the provided box when not in use.

- Avoid wearing your jewelry when cleaning, gardening and doing sports activities.

- If your jewelry is set with diamonds or gemstones have the setting checked ones a year by NUIT et LINETTE.

settings.heading: HOW TO CLEAN YOUR JEWELRY:
settings.text:
Clean your jewelry regularly

– Place your jewelry in a bowl with mild soap and warm water. Let it soak for 15-30 minutes depending on how much dirt you have to remove.

- Use a soft toothbrush and scrub gently in the warm water.

settings.heading: GOLD
settings.text:
Analyses of some of the oldest rock samples on Earth provides clear evidence that the planet’s reserves of precious metals are the result of a bombardment of meteorites more than 200 million years after the Earth was formed.

NUIT et LINETTE will only create jewelry in solid 18 K or 14 K gold.

White gold is an alloy and will never be perfectly white. Therefore, all NUIT et LINETTE’s white gold jewelry is plated with rhodium. The layer will slowly fade over time depending on how frequently the jewelry is being worn. To maintain the white or black look the jewelry must be plated with rhodium by NUIT et LINETTE again depending on how frequently the jewelry is being worn. Please contact NUIT et LINETTE if you want a new rhodium plating for your gold jewelry.

settings.heading: SILVER
settings.text: Many of our 925 sterling silver jewelry designs are surface treated or oxidized. The surface treatment will fade over time because of contact with clothes, water, sweat and hard surfaces. The black oxidized layer slowly fades with daily or frequent wear.

settings.heading: COLOR GRADE
settings.text: The color grade of a diamond refers to the absence of color. Colorless diamonds are graded on a scale starting from D to Z. The less color in a diamond, the rarer and more valuable it is. When creating engagement rings NUIT et LINETTE will help each client select a diamond with one of the following color grades D, E, F, G or H.

settings.heading: CLARITY GRADE
settings.text: Almost all diamonds have small natural imperfections as internal inclusions and external blemishes. The clarity grade is based on the size, placement, quantity and nature of these imperfections also called clarity characteristics. Most of these characteristics are to small to be seen by the unaided eye and must be seen with a 10X magnification. The clarity grades go from Flawless (FL) with no inclusions and no blemishes to Included (I) with obvious inclusions under a 10X magnification. NUIT et LINETTE diamonds will range from Flawless (F) to Slightly Included (SI1) clarity grade

settings.heading: CUT GRADE
settings.text: The most important factor of the 4 Cs is the diamonds cut. The polish, symmetry, proportion and arrangement of the facets determines how well the diamond interacts with light. On a well cut diamond the light will enter through the crown reflect inside from one pavilion facet to another and exit through the crown, reappear to the eye as fire, brilliance and sparkle. The cut grade ranges from Excellent to Poor. For center stones in engagement rings NUIT et LINETTE will only select diamonds with Excellent and Very Good cut grades.

settings.heading: CARAT WEIGHT
settings.text: Carat refers to the diamonds weight and 1.00 carat equals 0.2 grams. Generally, diamonds with a higher carat weight will have a higher value. But two diamonds with the same carat weight often vary in value as they differ in color, clarity and cut. Therefore, it is important to consider all aspects of the 4Cs when two diamonds with equal carat weight is being compared.
